d533835c-70c6-4398-ae75-6ae3244bc32d.description: The Payment Card Industry Professional (PCIP) is an individual certification in payment security information that provides you with the tools to help your organization build a secure payment environment. PCIP's demonstrates a level of understanding that can provide a strong foundation for a career in the payments security industry. This renewable career certification is not affected by changes in employment assignments and stays in effect as long as the individual continues to meet requirements.
d533835c-70c6-4398-ae75-6ae3244bc32d.name: Payment Card Industry Professional (PCIP)

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI DSS
alignments.description: PCI DSS provides a baseline of technical and operational requirements designed to protect account data. The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) was developed to encourage and enhance cardholder data security and facilitate the broad adoption of consistent data security measures globally.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the PCIP training course or have the required industry experience
Receive a passing score on the PCIP Exam
Provide proof of information technology or payment card industry experience
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility
Maintain and submit evidence of Continuing Professional Education credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide

2240694a-a1ef-454c-b225-1bb686c40db3.description: Qualified Security Assessors (QSA) are individuals who are employed by a QSA Company and have satisfied and continue to satisfy all QSA Requirements and can perform Assessments using the PCI Data Security Standards (PCI DSS).
2240694a-a1ef-454c-b225-1bb686c40db3.name: PCI Qualified Security Assessor (QSA)

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI Data Security Standard
alignments.description: PCI DSS provides a baseline of technical and operational requirements designed to protect account data. The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) was developed to encourage and enhance cardholder data security and facilitate the broad adoption of consistent data security measures globally.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by an active QSA Company that is active with the PCI SSC.
Provide proof of information technology or payment card experience as documented in the PCI DSS Qualification Requirements for Qualified Security Assessors document.
Complete the QSA training course
Receive a passing score on the QSA Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility

92c64c35-e83f-4272-b08a-93c6aab5d20f.description: Internal Security Assessors are taught how to perform internal assessments for their company and recommend solutions to remediate issues related to PCI DSS compliance. Assessors are sponsored by their companies, so when you receive this qualification you will be able to act as a liaison with external PCI auditors and manage interactions with a Qualified Security Assessor (QSA).
92c64c35-e83f-4272-b08a-93c6aab5d20f.name: PCI Internal Security Assessor (ISA)

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI DSS
alignments.description: PCI DSS provides a baseline of technical and operational requirements designed to protect account data. The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) was developed to encourage and enhance cardholder data security and facilitate the broad adoption of consistent data security measures globally.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by a sponsor ISA company and complete the ISA registration form.
Ensure that the candidate meets the qualification requirements for relevant industry experience.
Complete the required ISA training course
Receive a passing score on the ISA Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility

Maintain evidence of Continuing Professional Education credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide as well as complete annual training and examination on the PCI Data Security Standards (PCI DSS)

4f18f0f3-18f3-4c62-8683-c969c0a48f5f.description: Qualified Integrators and Resellers (QIRs) serve an important role in the payments and information technology value chain. QIRs help their merchant customers improve payment data security and reduce risk by implementing the critical security controls to mitigate the most common causes of payment data breaches.
4f18f0f3-18f3-4c62-8683-c969c0a48f5f.name: PCI Qualified Integrator and Reseller (QIR)

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI DSS
alignments.description: PCI DSS provides a baseline of technical and operational requirements designed to protect account data. The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) was developed to encourage and enhance cardholder data security and facilitate the broad adoption of consistent data security measures globally.

alignments.name: PA-DSS
alignments.description: PA-DSS defines security requirements and assessment procedures for software vendors of payment applications.

alignments.name: Secure Software
alignments.description: The PCI Secure Software requirements provide assurance that payment software is designed, engineered, developed and maintained in a manner that protects payment transactions and data, minimizes vulnerabilities, and defends itself from attacks.

badge_template_activities.title: Provide proof of information technology or payment card industry installation or integration experience.
Completed the QIR training course.
Receive a passing score on the QIR Exam.
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility

a0780650-8848-4569-a84c-e707c3544a0a.description: Qualified PIN Assessors (QPAs) are Assessors that have been qualified by the PCI Security Standards Council to perform assessments to validate an entity's compliance to the PCI PIN Security Standard. QPA’s are employed by a QPA Company and have demonstrated that they satisfy all qualification requirements as defined by PCI SSC within the documented QPA Qualification Requirements.
a0780650-8848-4569-a84c-e707c3544a0a.name: PCI Qualified PIN Assessor (QPA)

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI PIN Security Standard
alignments.description: PCI PIN contains a complete set of requirements for the secure management, processing, and transmission of personal identification number (PIN) data during online and offline payment card transaction processing at ATMs and point-of-sale (POS) terminals.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by an active QPA Company that is active with the PCI SSC.
Provide proof of information technology or payment card experience as documented in the PCI Qualified PIN Assessors document.
Complete the QPA training course
Receive a passing score on the QPA Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility

0eeef7fd-44c4-4e75-b7b9-b58adb78165d.description: Qualification as an Assocaite QSA(AQSA) prepares you to support and learn from Qualified Security Assessors (QSAs) as they perform assessments of merchants and service providers who must comply with the PCI Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). Upon successful completion of the training and exam, trainees are able to assist in PCI DSS assessments.
0eeef7fd-44c4-4e75-b7b9-b58adb78165d.name: PCI Associate Qualified Security Assessor (AQSA)

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI Data Security Standard
alignments.description: PCI DSS provides a baseline of technical and operational requirements designed to protect account data. The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) was developed to encourage and enhance cardholder data security and facilitate the broad adoption of consistent data security measures globally.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by an active QSA Company that is active with the PCI SSC and has an active AQSA mentoring program in operation.

Associate QSAs must be employed by an eligible QSA Company. Pre-requisites also include a college or university degree in an IT or security-related field or two years’ experience in IT or security. Once all relevant QSA Requirements have been met an AQSA can transition to the role of a QSA.
Complete the QSA training course
Receive a passing score on the QSA Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility
Maintain Continuing Professional Education credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide as well as complete annual training and examination on the PCI Data Security Standards (PCI DSS)

9531960c-e5a8-4acd-ba5d-fff39d39f306.description: 3DS Assessors are qualified by PCI SSC to perform assessments using the PCI 3DS Core Security Standard. 3DS Assessor Employees are individuals who are employed by a 3DS Assessor Company and have satisfied all 3DS Assessor Qualification Requirements applicable to employees of 3DS Assessor Companies who will conduct 3DS Assessments.
9531960c-e5a8-4acd-ba5d-fff39d39f306.name: 3-Domain Secure (3DS) Assessor

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI 3DS Core Security Standard
alignments.description: The PCI 3DS Security Requirements and Assessment Procedures for EMV® 3-D Secure Core Components. The standard defines physical and logical security requirements and assessment procedures for entities that perform or provide the following requirements for those entities engaging in 3DS activities.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by an active QSA Company that is active with the PCI SSC.
Provide proof of information technology or payment card experience as documented in the PCI 3DS Qualifications Requirements.
Complete the 3DS training course
Receive a passing score on the 3DS Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility

8365bae3-af04-4d67-bb59-e34881cd7729.description: Secure Software Assessors (SSA) are individuals who are employed by an SSF Company and have satisfied and continue to satisfy all SSA Requirements and can perform Assessments using the PCI Secure Software standard.
8365bae3-af04-4d67-bb59-e34881cd7729.name: PCI Secure Software Assessor

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI Secure Software
alignments.description: PCI Secure Software standard provides a baseline of security requirements with corresponding assessment procedures and guidance for building secure payment software.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by an SSF Company that is active with the PCI SSC.
Provide proof of information technology, software development or payment card experience as documented in the PCI Software Security Framework – Qualification Requirements for Assessors document.
Complete the SSA training course
Receive a passing score on the SSA Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility
Maintain Continuing Professional Education credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide as well as complete annual training and examination on the PCI Secure Software standard.

e8a38fa3-8951-48a8-add7-8a2376a26115.description: Secure Software Lifecycle (SLC) Assessors (SSLCA) are individuals who are employed by an SSF Company and have satisfied and continue to satisfy all SSLCA Requirements and can perform Assessments using the PCI Secure Software Lifecycle (SLC) standard.
e8a38fa3-8951-48a8-add7-8a2376a26115.name: PCI Secure Software Lifecycle (SLC) Assessor

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI Secure Software Lifecycle (SLC)
alignments.description: PCI Secure Software Lifecycle (SLC) standard provides a baseline of security requirements with corresponding assessment procedures and guidance to help software vendors design, develop, and maintain secure software throughout the software lifecycle.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by an SSF Company that is active with the PCI SSC.
Provide proof of information technology, software development or payment card experience as documented in the PCI Software Security Framework – Qualification Requirements for Assessors document.
Complete the SSLCA training course
Receive a passing score on the SSLCA Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility

Maintain Continuing Professional Education credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide as well as complete annual training and examination on the PCI Secure Software Lifecycle (SLC) standard.

fd94c607-caac-45bc-8520-7167f572b8c0.description: The Point-to-Point Encryption Assessor and Point-to-Point Encryption Application Assessor are able to perform assessments of Point-to-Point Encryption solutions and applications against the latest P2PE standard in order for those solutions and applications to be listed on the PCI Council website.
fd94c607-caac-45bc-8520-7167f572b8c0.name: PCI P2PE Assessor

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI P2PE Standard
alignments.description: The objective of this standard is to protect account data by encrypting that data from the point of interaction (POI) within the encryption environment where account data is captured through to the point of decrypting that data inside a decryption environment.

badge_template_activities.title: Be an active QSA employed by an active QSA or QPA Company that is active with the PCI SSC and have completed at least two PCI DSS Assessments as a QSA employee, or at least two PCI PIN Assessments as a QPA employee.
Have the necessary experience and knowledge as documented in the P2PE qualification requirements document.
Complete the P2PE Assessors training course
Receive a passing score on the P2PE Assessor Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility
Maintain Continuing Professional Education credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide as well as complete annual training and examination on the PCI Data Security Standards (PCI DSS)

25ad28c1-c081-4720-869e-5d2b49dc9ddc.description: Card Production Security Assessors - Logical (CPSA-L) are individuals who are employed by a CPSA Company, have satisfied and continue to satisfy all CPSA-L Qualification Requirements, and can perform assessments using the Card Production and Provisioning Logical Security Requirements.
25ad28c1-c081-4720-869e-5d2b49dc9ddc.name: Card Production Security Assessor - Logical

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI Card Production Physical Security Standard
alignments.description: The Card Production and Provisioning Logical Security Requirements address systems and business processes associated with the logical security activities in card production and provisioning such as data preparation, pre-personalization, card personalization, PIN generation, PIN mailers, and card carriers and distribution.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by an active CPSA Company that is active with the PCI SSC.
Provide proof of network and systems security experience as documented in the PCI Qualification Requirements for Card Production Security Assessors document.
Complete the CPSA-L training course.
Receive a passing score on the CPSA-L Exam.
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility

Maintain professional certifications or Continuing Professional Education (CPE) credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide. Complete annual training and examination as described by the CPSA-L Qualification Requirements.

aa74b090-10d5-4178-bb09-8a98786882f2.description: Card Production Security Assessors - Physical (CPSA-P) are individuals who are employed by a CPSA Company, have satisfied and continue to satisfy all CPSA-P Qualification Requirements, and can perform assessments using the Card Production and Provisioning Physical Security Requirements.
aa74b090-10d5-4178-bb09-8a98786882f2.name: Card Production Security Assessor - Physical

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI Card Production Physical Security Standard
alignments.description: Card Production and Provisioning Physical Security Requirements address the physical security requirements and procedures that entities must follow before, during, and after card manufacturing, chip embedding, personalization, storage, packaging, mailing, shipping and delivery of payment cards.

badge_template_activities.title: Be employed by an active CPSA Company that is active with the PCI SSC.
Provide proof of physical and system security experience as documented in the PCI Qualification Requirements for Card Production Security Assessors document.
Complete the CPSA-P training course.
Receive a passing score on the CPSA-P Exam.
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility

Maintain professional certifications or Continuing Professional Education (CPE) credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide. Complete annual training and examination as described by the CPSA-P Qualification Requirements.

skills.name: Analyze Existing Physical Networking And Security Components And Processes And Operations

b79303c6-b526-4db5-b75b-a36c4196180b.description: The Point-to-Point Encryption Assessor and Point-to-Point Encryption Application Assessor are able to perform assessments of Point-to-Point Encryption solutions and applications against the latest P2PE standard in order for those solutions and applications to be listed on the PCI Council website.
b79303c6-b526-4db5-b75b-a36c4196180b.name: PCI P2PE Application Assessor

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI P2PE Standard
alignments.description: The objective of this standard is to protect account data by encrypting that data from the point of interaction (POI) within the encryption environment where account data is captured through to the point of decrypting that data inside a decryption environment.

badge_template_activities.title: Be an active QSA employed by a QSA Company that is active with the PCI SSC and participating in the Software Security Frameworks (SSF) program.
Have the necessary experience and knowledge as documented in the P2PE qualification requirements document.
Complete the P2PE Application Assessor training course
Receive a passing score on the P2PE Application Assessor Exam
Agree to abide by and support the PCI Code of Professional Responsibility
Maintain Continuing Professional Education credits as documented in the PCI SSC CPE Maintenance Guide as well as complete annual training and examination on the PCI Data Security Standards (PCI DSS)

dfe27c37-5746-49c6-a089-cc49bfd8a326.description: This PCI PIN v3.1 Knowledge Training Badge signifies only that the recipient has attended and successfully completed the corresponding PCI Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) training course and exam. Neither this certificate, nor successful completion of such training and exam qualifies the recipient to perform any PCI SSC-related assessments or services.
dfe27c37-5746-49c6-a089-cc49bfd8a326.name: PCI PIN v3.1 Knowledge Training

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: PCI PIN v3.1
alignments.description: PCI PIN contains a complete set of requirements for the secure management, processing, and transmission of personal identification number (PIN) data during online and offline payment card transaction processing at ATMs and point-of-sale (POS) terminals.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the PCI PIN v3.1 training course and passed a knowledge exam.

ac6defd5-f35d-4fe7-8be2-87addfc2a6a3.description: This Card Production and Provisioning - Logical v3.0.1 Knowledge Training Badge signifies only that the recipient has attended and successfully completed the corresponding PCI Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) training course and exam. Neither this certificate, nor successful completion of such training and exam qualifies the recipient to perform any PCI SSC-related assessments or services.

alignments.description: The Card Production and Provisioning Logical Security Requirements address systems and business processes associated with the logical security activities in card production and provisioning such as data preparation, pre-personalization, card personalization, PIN generation, PIN mailers, and card carriers and distribution.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the PCI Card Production and Provisioning - Logical training course and passed a knowledge exam.

61c402f5-560b-47a8-bd52-b93767c2da59.description: This Card Production and Provisioning - Physical v3.0.1 Knowledge Training Badge signifies only that the recipient has attended and successfully completed the corresponding PCI Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) training course and exam. Neither this certificate, nor successful completion of such training and exam qualifies the recipient to perform any PCI SSC-related assessments or services.
61c402f5-560b-47a8-bd52-b93767c2da59.name: Card Production and Provisioning - Physical v3.0.1 Knowledge Training

alignments.description: Card Production and Provisioning Physical Security Requirements address the physical security requirements and procedures that entities must follow before, during, and after card manufacturing, chip embedding, personalization, storage, packaging, mailing, shipping and delivery of payment cards.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the PCI Card Production and Provisioning - Physical training course and passed a knowledge exam.

e4ae2a31-2f30-4ac9-bd09-57dcf183f553.description: This PCI 3DS Core v1.0 Knowledge Training Badge signifies only that the recipient has attended and successfully completed the corresponding PCI Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) training course and exam. Neither this certificate, nor successful completion of such training and exam qualifies the recipient to perform any PCI SSC-related assessments or services.
e4ae2a31-2f30-4ac9-bd09-57dcf183f553.name: PCI 3-Domain Secure (3DS) Core v1.0 Knowledge Training

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.description: The PCI 3DS Security Requirements and Assessment Procedures for EMV® 3-D Secure Core Components. The standard defines physical and logical security requirements and assessment procedures for entities that perform or provide the following requirements for those entities engaging in 3DS activities.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the PCI 3DS v1.0 Core training course and passed a knowledge exam.

93fc2c75-5ec4-4526-afb5-cd9fa3da4c9a.description: This PCI Point-to-Point Encryption (P2PE) v3.1 Knowledge Training Badge signifies only that the recipient has attended and successfully completed the corresponding PCI Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) training course and exam. Neither this certificate, nor successful completion of such training and exam qualifies the recipient to perform any PCI SSC-related assessments or services.
93fc2c75-5ec4-4526-afb5-cd9fa3da4c9a.name: Point-to-Point Encryption (P2PE) v3.1 Knowledge Training

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: Point-to-Point (P2PE) Standard v3.1
alignments.description: The objective of this standard is to protect account data by encrypting that data from the point of interaction (POI) within the encryption environment where account data is captured through to the point of decrypting that data inside a decryption environment.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the PCI Point-to-Point Encryption (P2PE) v3.1 training course and passed a knowledge exam.

55ae0030-6c50-4a57-8643-893c1f13c6b3.description: This Secure Software Lifecycle v1.1 Knowledge Training Badge signifies only that the recipient has attended and successfully completed the corresponding PCI Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) training course and exam. Neither this certificate, nor successful completion of such training and exam qualifies the recipient to perform any PCI SSC-related assessments or services.
55ae0030-6c50-4a57-8643-893c1f13c6b3.name: Secure Software Lifecycle (SLC) v1.1 Knowledge Training

issuer.summary: issued by PCI Security Standards Council

alignments.name: Secure Software Lifecycle Standard v1.1
alignments.description: PCI Secure Software Lifecycle (SLC) Standard provides a baseline of security requirements with corresponding assessment procedures and guidance to help software vendors design, develop, and maintain secure software throughout the software lifecycle.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Secure Software Lifecycle v1.1 training course and passed a knowledge exam.

304a41a5-51d5-41d7-ab2e-21d649e3f805.description: This Secure Software v1.1 Knowledge Training Badge signifies only that the recipient has attended and successfully completed the corresponding PCI Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) training course and exam. Neither this certificate, nor successful completion of such training and exam qualifies the recipient to perform any PCI SSC-related assessments or services.
304a41a5-51d5-41d7-ab2e-21d649e3f805.name: Secure Software v1.1 Knowledge Training

alignments.name: Secure Software Standard v1.1
alignments.description: PCI Secure Software Standard provides a baseline of security requirements with corresponding assessment procedures and guidance for building secure payment software.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the Secure Software Assessor v1.1 training course and passed a knowledge exam.
